loudness_zwtv(signal, fs, field_type='free')[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate Zwicker-loudness for time-varying signals Calculate the acoustic loudness according to Zwicker method for time-varying signals. Normatice reference:

DIN 45631/A1:2010 ISO 532-1:2017 (method 2)

The code is based on C program source code published alongside with ISO 532-1 standard. Note that for reasons of normative continuity, as defined in the preceeding standards, the method is in accordance with ISO 226:1987 equal loudness contours (instead of ISO 226:2003) :param signal: A time signal values [Pa]. :type signal: numpy.array :param fs: Sampling frequency. :type fs: integer :param field_type: Type of soundfield corresponding to signal (‚Äúfree‚Äù by or ‚Äúdiffuse‚Äù). :type field_type: str :param Outputs: :param ‚Äî‚Äî-: :param N: Calculated loudness [sones], size (Ntime,). :type N: float :param N_specific: Specific loudness [sones/bark], size (Nbark, Ntime). :type N_specific: numpy.ndarray :param bark_axis: Corresponding bark axis, size (Nbark,). :type bark_axis: numpy.ndarray :param time_axis: Time axis, size (Ntime,). :type time_axis: numpy.ndarray
